Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

It only took one flash for the next memory to be there.  Flash, memory, fla=
sh, memory...the process continued.  He couldn't see any of his physical su=
rroundings, only the memories and flashbacks.  For all he knew, the flashba=
cks might actually be where he was.  He could see two faces looming above h=
im, staring down at him, but he couldn't make out any details, the faces we=
re blurry.  He thought he could hear them talking, but to his hearing it wa=
s unclear gabbing which he couldn't make out the meaning of.  And then that=
's when it struck him that he was on his back.  He could sense that he wasn=
't on the lowest ground, but was laid out on a bed-like object.  A sharp pa=
in struck through his back and spread throughout his body like a disease.  =
The pain was a piercing chill, and it was clear to him that his "bed" was m=
ade from some sort of metal.  Where am I?  What's happening?  Is this real?=
  These were only a few of the questions circulating in his mind like a rag=
ing tornado.  Vision was still blurry, and he didn't have much energy in hi=
m.  However, he mustered the strength to extend his arm out in front of him=
.  He held it there for a moment, staring at it, trying to focus on the cur=
rent scene before him.  But it was all to no avail.  The vision was still f=
ogged, but he could make out one thing.  And it was the last he'd ever see =
of this place, for a while.  A second arm, not belonging to him, had grabbe=
d his own arm.  A third arm came in, and it appeared to him that the hand o=
n this arm was holding a long, thin object.  At that moment, that unidentif=
ied long, thin object was thrust into his arm, and he felt nothing.....unti=
l he started to feel a large wave of vertigo overcome him, and the optical =
focus he had left was diminishing quickly.  Suddenly, everything he saw bec=
ame red, as if he had infra-red vision.  His eyes were rapidly getting heav=
ier.  He could make out that the two faces above him were talking, and then=
 they were waving something in front of his face and saying something that =
sounded to him like, "THIS IS NOT A GAME.....THIS IS NOT GAME.....".  Howev=
er, he couldn't be sure, because his hearing was not any better at this poi=
nt, it was only getting worse as he lost awareness, and vision faded.  And =
the same statement was repeated, over and over again.  "THIS IS NOT A GAME.=
....THIS IS NOT A GAME.....THIS IS NOT A GAME.....".  Each time it was said=
, the phrase seemed to get slower and slower, and then finally...he closed =
his eyes.  The redness, the object being waved, the faces....they were all =
gone...and his mind became a blank, empty void.
------=_NextPart_000_001C_01C31D93.35A35340
